metadata.name: Modification or Deletion of an AWS RDS Cluster
metadata.comment: Detects modifications to an RDS cluster or its deletion, which may indicate potential data exfiltration attempts, unauthorized access, or exposure of sensitive information.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('rds.amazonaws.com') AND (lower(LOWER(metadata.event_code)) in ('modifydbcluster', 'deletedbcluster')))

output.summary: Detects modifications to an RDS cluster or its deletion, which may indicate potential data exfiltration attempts, unauthorized access, or exposure of sensitive information.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Verify if the modification or deletion was performed by an authorized administrator. 2. Confirm if the modification or deletion was part of a planned change or maintenance activity. References: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/APIReference/API_ModifyDBCluster.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteDBCluster.html, https://cloud.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-cloud/aws-security/aws-privilege-escalation/aws-rds-privesc#rds-modifydbinstance
